questions.text: A road traffic victim was taken to the emergency. The type of injury shown in the Image is
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Crush If the blunt force produces extensive bruising and laceration of deeper tissues, it is called a "crushing" injury. The force may be produced by some moving weapon or object or by a fall. Other Options A, B, and C: Blunt, Penetrative or Blast injuries don't produce such extensive yet localized Hence are not the correct answers.

questions.text: A patient with a head injury was examined by a junior resident. He marked the forehead wound as an incised wound. The consultant pointed out it as a lacerated wound. Incised-looking lacerations are examples of
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Split lacerations Incised-like or Incised-looking Wounds : Split lacerations produced without excessive skin crushing may have relatively sharp margins. Blunt force on areas where the skin is close to the bone, and the subcutaneous tissues are scanty, may produce a wound that by the linear splitting of the tissues (as the skin is easily stretched during impact), may look like an incised The sites are the scalp, eyebrows, cheekbones, lower jaw, iliac crest, perineum, and shin. A wound produced by a fall on the knee or elbow with the limb flexed, and by a broken glass or sharp stone also simulates an incised

Chop Wound - A wound caused by a heavy weapon or instrument with at least one sharp cutting edge—e.g., axe, machete, panga; often the wound has abraded margins—which may be scraped off—and maybe thus confused with a laceration; chop wounds over bone may have a groove or cut in the underlying bone—e.g., skull. questions.text: A hits B with a blunt weapon on the head. B goes into a coma and later dies. No gross postmortem findings are noted in B. Cause of death is given as diffuse axonal injury. An important finding in such cases is
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Retraction Balls After 12 hours of injury, the axons first appear dilated, then club-shaped, and finally appear as round balls known as "retraction balls", which indicate transected axons indicating diffuse axonal injury. The number of retraction balls begins to decrease 2 to 3 weeks after injury, and clusters of microglial cells appear, followed by astrocytosis and demyelination.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options: - Other Options A B and C: Subdural, Subarachnoid, and Extradural hemorrhages are not findings in Diffuse Axonal Injury. Hence these options are not the correct options.

questions.text: A person was admitted to the emergency with multiple stab wounds over the chest and abdomen. He was scheduled for laparotomy. Which of the following statements is true about stab wounds?

options.label: C
options.text: Depth is more than length & breadth

options.label: D
options.text: Has irregular margins and is broader than the edge of the weapon

questions.correct_answer: C. Depth is more than length & breadth
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Depth is more than length & breadth Stab or Puncture Wound: A stab wound is produced from the penetration of a pointed instrument, such as a knife, dagger, nail, needle, spear, arrow, screwdriver, etc.

questions.text: A person was beaten black and blue by police personnel in lockup with batons. Ante mortem bruise is identified best by which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Histology On histology of the wound, a post-mortem wound would not show any cellular changes, evidence of edema, RBCs, etc.

questions.text: A resident posted in the emergency was noting the injuries of an assault victim. He was careful in interpreting every injury. Site notorious for incised looking Lacerated wounds is all except:
questions.explanation:

Chest The chest is not an area where subcutaneous tissues are scanty and the skin is not close to the bones. We have breast fatty tissues between the skin and the rib bones. Hence incised looking lacerated wounds are not seen usually in the chest region.
